modules.description: This module defines a set of roles used to represent different levels of user access within a web application. It includes functions for pretty-printing these roles, enabling clear display in logs or UI components. The role system is used to enforce access control policies, such as determining whether a user can rebuild jobs or manage log rules.

This module handles web request contexts, providing functions to create contexts from HTTP requests, retrieve request data, and manage user authentication via CSRF tokens and login operations. It works with Cohttp request and response types, CSRF tokens, and user data. Concrete use cases include handling form submissions with CSRF protection, redirecting users after login, and rendering templated HTML responses with optional auto-refresh.

This module defines a web site with role-based access control, handling user authentication and authorization through provided callbacks. It works with user and role types to manage permissions and includes configuration for security settings like cookies and CSRF protection. Concrete use cases include restricting pipeline access based on user roles and setting up authenticated web interfaces with custom routing.

This module represents and constructs user identities with string-based IDs, providing functions to create and access user values. It works with a concrete user type that encapsulates string identifiers, supporting use cases like authentication and user tracking. Functions include safe creation with error handling and direct ID extraction.

This module configures and runs a web server for a Current engine, handling network settings, routing, and site serving with support for role-based access control and user authentication. It defines core types for hosts, ports, server modes, and routes, while integrating child modules that manage user roles, request contexts, identity handling, and secure web interfaces. Operations include mapping routes to resources, enforcing access policies based on user roles, processing CSRF-protected form submissions, and redirecting authenticated users. Specific use cases include launching an authenticated web UI with custom routing, restricting pipeline access, and rendering templated HTML responses with user-specific data.
